Just Cause of Koreans Supported by NAM
articles.content:
Just Cause of Koreans Supported by NAM 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A final document adopted at the Non-Aligned Foreign Ministers' Conference in Durban, South Africa, on Aug. 19 expressed full support to the Korean people in their just cause.
 The document hoped that Korea would be reunified according to the true desire of the Korean people and by their concerted efforts as clarified by the three principles of national reunification and the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.    
 Noting that the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula should be peacefully settled through dialogue and negotiations, it called upon the countries concerned to make every possible effort to this end.

articles.title: Guarantee of Three Rights of Labor Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Guarantee of Three Rights of Labor Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) issued a statement on Aug. 23 demanding the guarantee of the three rights of labor to the Public Employees' Union, according to south Korean MBC.
 It accused the "government" and the ruling party of having decided to present the bill on the above-said union banning the rights of all actions including a strike and slowdown of unionists to the "regular National Assembly session" slated for next month.    
 The KCTU branded the action not to guarantee the right of collective actions out of the three rights of labor, basic rights of trade unions, as an intention to reduce the union to an organization in name only.

Greetings to President of Moldova
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Moldova
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Vladimir Woronin, president of the Republic of Moldova, on the occasion of its national day.
 In the message he wished the president of Moldova greater success in his work for the country's prosperity and the welfare of the people and expressed the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong in the interests of the two peoples.
